1125387362937245698.text: Not to be confused with riccardian contracts, which are legal contracts whose redemption clauses are validated cryptographically by a legal authority which will enforce it coercively based on cryptographic evidence such as digital signatures and cryptocurrency transactions.

1125386566422204416.text:
Notable examples:

multisignature contracts: needs a threshold of valid signatures to be redeemed 

 time-locked contracts: can only be redeemed after a certain block height

1125386003856986113.text: Smart contracts are conditionally locked transactions whose redemption clauses are validated by a distributed consensus escrow.  Participants enforce the clauses by accepting the redemeemed funds as valid money, unlocking them, knowing that any further recipient will do the same.
